cookieAcceptDecline.text: We use cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website.

cookiePolicy.categoryOfUse:
Categories of use

Authentication

If you’re signed in to Inspectorama, cookies help us show you the right information and personalize your experience.

Security

We use cookies to enable and support our security features, and to help us detect malicious activity and violations of our User Agreement.

Preferences, features and services

Cookies can tell us which language you prefer and what your communications preferences are. They can help you fill out forms on Inspectorama more easily. They also provide you with features, insights, and customized content in conjunction with our plugins.

Performance, Analytics and Research

Cookies help us learn how well our site performs in different locations. We also use cookies to understand, improve, and research products, features, and services, including when you access Inspectorama from other websites, applications, or devices such as your work computer or your mobile device.
cookiePolicy.intro:
Effective on November 18, 2019

At Zigma Inspection Services AS, also known and referred to in this document asInspectorama, we believe in being clear and open about how we collect and use data related to you. In the spirit of transparency, this policy provides detailed information about how and when we use cookies. This cookie policy applies to any Inspectorama product or service that links to this policy or incorporates it by reference.
cookiePolicy.mainTable:

Description

Authentication

Performance, Analytics and Research

cookiePolicy.questionsAndAnswersBottom:
Controlling cookies

Most browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings preferences. However, if you limit the ability of websites to set cookies, you may worsen your overall user experience, since it will no longer be personalized to you. It may also stop you from saving customized settings like login information.

What to do if you don’t want cookies to be set or want them to be removed?

If you do not want to receive cookies, you can also change your browser settings on your computer or other device you’re using to access our services. If you use Inspectorama without changing your browser settings, we’ll assume that you’re happy to receive all cookies on the Inspectorama website. Most browsers also provide functionality that lets you review and erase cookies, including Inspectorama cookies. Please note that the Inspectorama site will not work properly without cookies.

To find out more about cookies, including how to see what cookies have been set and how to manage and delete them.
cookiePolicy.questionsAndAnswersTop:
Does Inspectorama use cookies?

Yes. As described in Section I(b) of our Privacy Policy, we use cookies and other technologies to ensure everyone who uses Inspectorama has the best possible experience. Cookies also help us keep your account safe. By continuing to visit or use our services, you are agreeing to the use of cookies and similar technologies for the purposes we describe in this policy.

What is a cookie?

A cookie is a small file placed onto your device that enables Inspectorama features and functionality. For example, cookies enable us to identify your device, secure your access to Inspectorama and our sites generally, and even help us know if someone attempts to access your account from a different device. Cookies also enable you to easily share content on Inspectorama and help us serve relevant ads to you.

When does Inspectorama place cookies?

We use cookies on our site and mobile applications. Any browser visiting these sites will receive cookies from us. We also place cookies in your browser when you visit non- Inspectorama sites that host our plugins.

What types of cookies does Inspectorama use?

We use two types: persistent cookies and session cookies. A persistent cookie helps us recognize you as an existing user, so it’s easier to return to Inspectorama or interact with our services without signing in again. After you sign in, a persistent cookie stays in your browser and will be read by Inspectorama when you return to our site. Session cookies only last for as long as the session (usually the current visit to a website or a browser session).

What are cookies used for?

Cookies can be used to recognize you when you visit Inspectorama, remember your preferences, and give you a personalized experience that’s in line with your settings. Cookies also make your interactions with Inspectorama faster and more secure. Additionally, cookies allow us to bring you advertising both on and off the Inspectorama sites

What is Do Not Track (DNT)?

DNT is a concept that has been promoted by regulatory agencies such as the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC), for the Internet industry to develop and implement a mechanism for allowing Internet users to control the tracking of their online activities across websites by using browser settings. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) has been working with industry groups, Internet browsers, technology companies, and regulators to develop a DNT technology standard. While some progress has been made, it has been slow. No standard has been adopted to this date. As such, Inspectorama does not generally respond to “do not track” signals.

articles.body:
To create an account:

1. Tap the Sign Up tab in the header.

2. Enter your first name, last name, email address and choose a password. You will have to enter your business name if you are registering as a business.

3. You can make changes to your profile by going to your Account Dashboard and editing your Profile Settings.
articles.title: How can I create an account?

articles.body: For now, we offer inspection services for vehicles and homes. We are working on rolling out new services for other types of inspections.
articles.title: What kind of inspection services does Inspectorama offer?

articles.body:
To create your order:

1. Register as a user - either as an individual or as a business. If already registered, login, go to Services and select the relevant inspection service.

2. Enter the details of the item to be inspected and get a quote.

3. On the quote page, complete the inspection order by providing more details for the task and then make payment.

4. Review the profiles of the matched inspectors and then approve one for the job.

You will be taken to the order page where you can make changes, reschedule or cancel your order. Cancellation or rescheduling will be based on our cancellation and rescheduling policy.
articles.title: How can I create an order?

articles.body: No, you cannot create an order anonymously. You first have to create an account, or log in as a user before creating an order.
articles.title: Can I create an order anonymously?

articles.body:
You can change the details of your order anytime before the inspection time so long as they do not affect the inspection price, location, or are beyond the purview of the inspector. 

To make changes to your order, go to your order page by clicking on My Orders tab in you account and then selecting the specific order.
articles.title: Can I change the details of my order?

articles.body:
To reschedule your order:

1. Go to your account and select My Orders.

2. On the My Orders page select the specific order.

3. On the specific order page, tap the Reschedule Booking  button and enter a new time and date in the popped up modal.

4. Then press Reschedule Booking on the modal to submit the request.  

If an inspector has been approved by you prior to the rescheduling, he or she will be re-booked automatically should they be available in the new time, otherwise, you will have to repeat the entire procedure of approving one of the newly matched inspectors.
articles.title: How can I reschedule my order?

articles.body:
To cancel your order:

1. Go to your account and select My Orders.

2. On the My Orders page select the specific order.

3. On the specific order page, tap the Cancel Booking .

4. In the popped up modal, you will have the chance to reschedule the booking or cancel outrightly. 

5. Then submit the request. You will receive an email confirmation.
articles.title: How can I cancel my order?

articles.body:
You can reschedule your order when:

1. It is more than 12 hours left before the inspection time if an inspector has already been approved by you

2. Or at any time if no inspector has been approved for the job by you.
articles.title: When can I reschedule my order?

articles.body:
You can cancel your order when:

1. It is more than 24 hours left before the inspection time if an inspector has already been approved by you

2. Or at any time, if no inspector has been approved for the job by you. 

Either of the above cases, you will get a full refund.

However. if there is less than 24 hours and more than 12 hours to the job, you can reschedule with the approved inspector or get your store wallet credited.

Should the approved inspector not show up for the job, for whatever reason, you will get a full refund.
articles.title: When can I cancel my order?

articles.body:
To register as an inspector:

1. Tap the Become an Inspector tab in the header.

2. Enter your first name, last name, email address, choose a password, select your area of inspection, country and city.

3. Follow the step by step process to fill out the relevant information about your personal and professional backgrounds.

4. Upon completing the registration, we will begin the process of vetting the information you have provided and subsequently approving or rejecting your application. We will contact you should we need any more information.

5. Should your application be successful, you will receive a notification and you will then be available for matchiing with customers.
articles.title: How can I register as an inspector?

articles.body: For now, we accept inspectors for vehicles and homes. We are working on rolling out new services for other types of inspections soon.
articles.title: Which kind of inspectors can register?

articles.body:
General requirements

1. Eligible to work in your country of residence.

2. A camera, internet connection and a computer for compiling reports.

Vehicle Inspector

1. Minimum of 1 year verifiable working experience as a mechanic or vehicle inspector.

2. At least 1 certification per specified vehicle brand specialization.

3. At least 1 certification per specified vehicle type specialization.

1. Minimum of 1 year verifiable working experience as a certified home inspector.

2. At least 1 professional certification per specified area of specialization.

3. Error & omission with general liability insurance cover.
articles.title: What are the requirements to become an inspector?

articles.body:
To accept or reject a job:

1. Sign into your account and go to Notifications.

2. The new job will be appear among your notifications. Here you can see a brief description of the job and the time. Click on the I am interested or Decline tab.

3. Should you accept the job, you will then wait for the customer to review your profile and then approve you for the job. The customer could as well reject your candidacy.

4. If approved, you can start communicating with the customer and begin preparations for the job.
articles.title: How do I accept or reject a job?

articles.body:
You can cancel a job when it is more than 24 hours left before the commencement of the job. Cancelling a job with less than 24 hours and more than 12 hours left will attract a fine of $50, and when less than 12 hours is left, a cancellation or a no-show will attract a fine of $80.

However, a reschedule agreed with the customer in advance will result in no fine.
articles.title: Can I cancel or reschedule an already accepted job?

articles.body: We only pay inspectors through a verified bank account in their name domiciled in their country
articles.title: How can I get paid?

articles.body:
You will have to submit your payment account details during your registration process.

To change your bank account details:

1. Go to your account and click on Dashboard.

2. Click on the Payment Info tab to see your bank account info.

3. Click on the Edit to make changes and then select Save.
articles.title: How do I submit or change my payment details?

articles.body: It will depend on the type of inspection, your location and your ratings. Inspectors with higher customer reviews will get slightly better pay than others. The amount you will earn for the job will be indicated in the notification.
articles.title: How much will I get paid for a job?

articles.body: We pay out inspectors on the next Friday that comes not less than 3 days after the job is completed. A job is deemed Completed when the customer accepts the report or after 3 days from the date of submitting the job report. The payment goes to the bank account details you have provided.
articles.title: When will I receive my payment for a job?

articles.body: Customers get the chance to tip inspectors after the job completion. Yes your tips are fully yours. You will receive them along with the regular weekly payout.
articles.title: Will I receive my tips?

articles.body: The bank charges are deducted by the bank before payment into your account and the amount varies from bank to bank. The breakdown will appear on your payment summary.
articles.title: Who is responsible for bank charges?

articles.body: The anmount depends on the earnings your referral has accrued on the Inspectorama platform. You will get paid 5% of their accrued earnings up to a maximum of $200. You will get credited after each job they complete until you have received the maximum paymemt.
articles.title: How much will I get for a referral?

articles.body: Upon your request, your referral payment gets transferred into you bank account or you will receive it as part of your regular weekly payout.
articles.title: How will I get paid the accrued referral?

articles.body:
To edit your profile information:

1. Go to your account and click on Dashboard.

2. Click on the Inspector Profile to view your profile information.

3. Select the Edit tab in the relevant sub-sections for you to enter new information.

However, note that editing some sensitive profile information can lead to the suspension of your account until our team has reveiewed the information.
articles.title: How can I edit my profile?

articles.body:
Changes like your education and professional certifications will lead to your account suspension pending a review by our team.

Changes like your name and address will prompt you to undergo an ID verification process and then your account will not lead to the suspension of your account, but you will be duely informed through a notification email.
articles.title: Which profile information editing can lead to my account suspension?

articles.body: We generally keep the data associated with your user account for as long as you have an account with us. If you close your account, we will erase your personal data as described in our Privacy Policy.
articles.title: How long does Inspectorama retain personal data?

articles.body:
Should you suspect someone has logged into your account:

1. Change your password.

2. Log into your account and go to your dashboard to review the last time you logged into your account and see if there is a suspicious log.
articles.title: What should I do if I think someone has logged into my account?

articles.body:
To reset your password:

1. In the header follow the Sign In or Log In tab and the click on Forgot Password?

2. Enter your email address and press the Send Email button. You will receive an email with a link to reset your password.

3. Follow the link in your email to enter a new password. You will receive an email confirming your password change.
articles.title: How do I reset my password?

changeToThisPolicy.body: If we change this Privacy Policy, we will post those changes on this page and update the Privacy Policy modification date below. If we materially change this Privacy Policy in a way that affects how we use or disclose your Personal Information, we will notify you by prominently posting a notice of such changes before making them and by stating the effective date of the changes.
changeToThisPolicy.title: VII CHANGE TO THIS PRIVACY POLICY

howWeProtectTheInfoWeCollect.body:
The security and confidentiality of your Personal Information is important to us. We have implemented technical, administrative, and physical security measures to protect your Personal Information from unauthorized access or disclosure and improper use.

For example, when users book services, the information they input is encrypted through TLS encryption. We do not store credit card information on our servers, and we use TLS encryption to protect your credit card information when it is transferred to our third-party payment processor. In addition, access to your Personal Information is restricted in our offices. Only employees who need the Personal Information to perform a specific job, for example, sales representatives, managers, and customer service staff, are granted access to Personal Information. All employees with access to Personal Information are kept up-to-date on our security and privacy practices. After a new policy is added, these employees are notified and/or reminded about the importance we place on privacy, and what they can do to enhance protection for our users' Personal Information.

It is important for you to protect against unauthorized access to your account password and to your computer. Be sure to log out of your account or to close your browser after you have completed your visit to our Site.

Please note that despite our reasonable efforts, no security measure is ever perfect or impenetrable, so we cannot guarantee the security of your Personal Information.
howWeProtectTheInfoWeCollect.title: IV. HOW WE PROTECT THE PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT

howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.3rdPartyInfoOnServices:
e) Third Parties Providing Information on Available Services or Marketing Offers

By using the Inspectorama Platform, you may be contacted, either by Inspectorama or directly by selected third parties, with opportunities to receive information on available services or marketing offers. If you agree to share your Personal Information to receive this information or marketing offers, your Personal Information may be disclosed to such third parties. All the information you disclose to the third parties will be subject to the privacy policy and practices of such third parties. We are not responsible for the privacy policies and practices of such third parties and, therefore, you should review the privacy policies and practices of such third parties prior to sharing your Personal Information with them. If you later decide that you no longer want to receive communication from such a third party, you will need to contact that third party directly.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.administrativeAndLegalReasons:
i) Administrative and Legal Reasons

Required Disclosures:

We may be required to disclose Personal Information in response to a court order, subpoena, civil discovery request, other legal process, or as otherwise required by law.

Legal Compliance and Protections:

We may disclose account and other Personal Information when we believe disclosure is necessary to comply with the law or to protect the rights, property, or safety of Inspectorama, our users, or others. This includes exchanging Personal Information with other companies and organizations for fraud prevention and credit risk reduction.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.affiliateCompanies:
a) Affiliated Companies

We may share your Personal Information among our various affiliates, parents, and subsidiaries, for purposes of facilitating aspects of services offered through the Inspectorama Platform and for marketing purposes.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.banksAndCreditCardCompanies:
d) Banks and Credit Card Companies

We may disclose your Personal Information to banks and credit card companies in the process of investigating payment fraud and/or responding to disputed charges.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.bookingPartners:
f) Booking Partners

We share your Personal Information with Booking Partners. For example, Amazon, Facebook customers can book services through the Inspectorama Platform from the Amazon, Facebook, including those customers in the United Kingdom and Norway, sites and apps. Upon request, we provide our Booking Partner with information about the services you booked or provided, as applicable, through the Inspectorama Platform.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.corporateTransactions:
j) Corporate Transactions

We reserve the right to disclose and transfer your information, including your Personal Information:

  • To a subsequent owner, co-owner, or operator of the Inspectorama Platform or successor database.
  • In connection with a corporate merger, consolidation, the sale of substantially all of our membership interests and/or assets or other corporate change, including to any prospective purchasers.

CHILDREN'S ONLINE PRIVACY PROTECTION ACT COMPLIANCE

We do not collect any information from anyone under 13 years of age. The Inspectorama Platform, and products and services offered through it, are all directed to people who are at least 13 years old or older. If you are under the age of 13, you are not authorized to use the Inspectorama Platform.

CALIFORNIA ONLINE PRIVACY PROTECTION ACT COMPLIANCE/YOUR CALIFORNIA PRIVACY RIGHTS

California residents who use the Inspectorama Platform may request that we provide certain information regarding our disclosure of your Personal Information to third parties for their direct marketing purposes. You can make such a request by e-mail to privacy@inspectorama.com or by mail to: Klems gate 34, Kongsberg, Norway.

YOUR NEVADA PRIVACY RIGHTS

Under Nevada law, Nevada residents may opt out of the sale of certain “covered information” collected by operators of websites or online services. We currently do not sell covered information, as “sale” is defined by such law, and we don’t currently have plans to sell this information. However, if you would like to be notified if we decide in the future to sell personal information covered by the Act, please email privacy@inspectorama.com to provide your name and email address. You are responsible for updating any change in your email address by the same method and we are not obligated to cross-reference other emails you may have otherwise provided us for other purposes. We will maintain this information and contact you if our plans change. At that time we will create a process for verifying your identity and providing an opportunity to verified consumers to complete their opt-out. Please become familiar with our data practices as set forth in this privacy policy. We may share your Personal Information as explained in this privacy policy, such as to enhance your experiences and our services, and those activities will be unaffected by a Nevada “do not sell request”. You may also have other choices regarding our data practices as set forth elsewhere in this privacy policy.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.promotions:
g) Sweepstakes, Contests and Promotions

We may offer sweepstakes, contests, and other promotions (any, a 'Promotion') through the Inspectorama Platform that may require providing Personal Information to register. By participating in a Promotion, you are agreeing to the official rules that govern that Promotion, which may contain specific requirements of you, including, allowing the sponsor of the Promotion to use your name, voice and/or likeness in advertising or marketing associated with the Promotion. Please read the official rules carefully. If you choose to enter a Promotion, Personal Information may be disclosed to third parties or the public in connection with the administration of such Promotion, including, in connection with winner selection, prize fulfillment, and as required by law or permitted by the Promotion's official rules, such as on a winners' list.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.serviceProfessionalProfile:
b) Service Professional Profiles, Service Instructions by Requesters, and Ratings and Reviews by Requesters

The Inspectorama Platform may display profiles of the service professionals who participate on the Inspectorama Platform. These profiles may include the service professional’s name, and ratings and reviews about the service professional provided by their customers. The service professional’s profile may be visible to all users of the Inspectorama Platform and on Booking Partners’ websites.

If you provide a rating or review about a service professional, we may post your first name, the initial of your last name, and the name of your neighborhood along with your rating or review on the service professional’s profile on the Inspectorama Platform and on Booking Partners’ websites. In addition, service professionals may use your ratings and reviews, as well as this personal information about you, in their own marketing materials.

If you provide information about your home to request a booking or a quote for a service, we may post your first name, the initial of your last name, the type of service requested, your zip code and region, the number of service providers requested, the date of your booking or quote request, your requested service date, and any description of the requested service or service instructions or notes that you provide on the Inspectorama Platform.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.socialNetworkAuthentication:
h) Social Network Site Authentication

If you choose to log-in to the Inspectorama Platform through Facebook, Twitter, or another social networking site, we may share information about your account with the social networking site.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.thirdPartyProvidingServices:
c) Third Parties Providing Services on Our Behalf

Third party companies and individuals provide or facilitate certain aspects of the services offered through the Inspectorama Platform on our behalf. We may provide these third-party service providers with access to your information, including your Personal Information, so that they can perform these services for us. We require these third-party service providers to provide safeguards for your Personal Information similar to the ones that we provide.

The following are some examples of how we share your information with third-party service providers.

  • Data Analytics. We retain third-party service providers to help us perform data analytics regarding your interactions with the Inspectorama Platform. For example, Google Analytics and Bounce Exchange may track what pages users visit on the Site, whether users use any coupon codes, and what services users request to determine how users use the Site. For example, Branch Metrics and Mixpanel collect and provide reports to us showing how you interact with the Inspectorama Platform using information, such as your IP address, browser ID and Device Identifier.
  • In some cases, these third-party service providers may in turn share your Personal Information, such as your name and email address, with other third parties for their marketing-related purposes.
  • Platform Features. Service providers help us to provide functions available through the Inspectorama Platform. For example, we may share your Device Identifier with Urban Airship so that it can help us to send you push notifications. We share your telephone number and call data with Twilio, as described in Section I(e), above, so that Twilio can mask your telephone number. We share your telephone number, call data, device id and other Inspectorama account and device information with Sendbird, as described in Section I(e), above, to help facilitate communication using the App.
  • Payment Processing. We use Stripe, a third-party service provider, to process any billing information, including credit card information you submit.
  • User Reviews Aggregation. We use third-party service providers, such as Bazaarvoice, to aggregate user reviews and publish them on third party websites.
  • Email Delivery. We use third-party service providers, such as Customer.io and Sendgrid, to deliver email to our users.
  • Background Check Service Providers. When service professionals applying to participate on the Inspectorama Platform in the United States provide their Social Security numbers for a background check, the Social Security number is transmitted using TLS encryption to the background check service provider. Inspectorama also securely provides U.S. service professional's Social Security| numbers to the check processor.
  • Marketing and Promotional Vendors and Partners. We may share Personal Information with third party service providers who assist us with marketing, and with other trusted parties whom we believe offer products or services that may be of interest to you..
  • Customer Support. We use third-party service providers to assist with providing customer support for questions you may have about your account and use of the Inspectorama Platform. We may disclose your Personal Information to such service providers to assist with responding to your questions.
  • Legal Advice. We may disclose your Personal Information to an attorney in the process of obtaining legal advice.
howWeShareTheInfoWeCollect.title:
III. HOW WE SHARE THE INFORMATION WE COLLECT

We may sell, rent, or trade your Personal Information to third parties as disclosed in this Privacy Policy at the time you provide your information. The following are some of the ways we share your information:

howWeUseTheInfoWeCollect.body:
We – including without limitation our affiliates, parents, and subsidiaries – use the information we collect to serve our customers, consider applicants, market and promote our services, and improve your experience at the Inspectorama Platform. Some examples include:

  • Scheduling, rescheduling, and cancelling services
  • Rating and reviewing service professionals
  • Providing public profiles of service professionals
  • Addressing service complaints
  • Communicating with you by email, telephone, or text message, in accordance with your wishes
  • Managing payments for services
  • Considering whether to engage service professionals on the Inspectorama Platform
  • Evaluating job applications to work at Inspectorama
  • Improving customer service
  • Sending you marketing and promotional emails, on behalf of Inspectorama or selected third parties, unless you have told us you do not want to receive such emails
  • Troubleshooting technical problems on the Inspectorama Platform
  • Responding to questions and feedback
  • Conducting research and analysis
  • Running online or mobile sweepstakes, contents, or other promotions
  • Marketing and advertising Inspectorama products and services and those of selected third parties
  • Continuously evaluating and improving the online and mobile user experience
  • Preventing, discovering and investigating violations of this Privacy Policy or any applicable terms of service or terms of use for the Mobile Application, and investigating fraud, chargebacks or other matters
  • Contacting you with regard to your use of the Inspectorama Platform and, in our discretion, changes to the Inspectorama Platform and/or the Inspectorama Platform policies
  • Compliance with the law or to protect the rights, property, or safety of Inspectorama, our users, or others, including to maintain network and information security, for fraud prevention, and to report suspected criminal acts

By using the Inspectorama platform, you expressly consent and agree to accept and receive communications from us, including via text message, calls, and push notifications to the cellular telephone number you provided to us. Standard text messaging charges applied by your cell phone carrier will apply to text messages we send. By consenting to being contacted by Inspectorama, you understand and agree that you may receive communications, including marketing communications generated by automatic telephone dialing systems and/or which will deliver prerecorded messages, sent by or on behalf of Inspectorama, its affiliated companies and/or Users/Professionals, including but not limited to: operational communications concerning your account or use of the Inspectorama Platform or Services, updates concerning new and existing features on the Inspectorama Platform, communications concerning promotions run by us, and news concerning Inspectorama and industry developments. You acknowledge that you are not required to consent to receive promotional messages as a condition of using the Inspectorama Platform or the Services. If a contact number you have provided to us is no longer your number, you agree to notify us promptly that you can no longer be reached at that number. You represent that you have received, and are authorized to convey to us, the consent of any authorized users on your account to be contacted by us as described in this Section. You agree that all consents provided in this Section will survive cancellation of your account. You may opt-out of receiving promotional or marketing texts or calls from Inspectorama at any time. You may opt-out of receiving all text (SMS) messages from Inspectorama (including informational or transactional messages) by replying with the word “STOP” to a text message from us; however you acknowledge that opting out of receiving all texts may impact your use of the Inspectorama Platform or the Services. You also acknowledge that Inspectorama or its third party service providers may record customer service calls after notice to you and with your consent, in order to assist you when you contact our customer support services.

You agree to Inspectorama’s use of a service provider to mask your telephone number when you call or exchange text (SMS) messages with a Service Professor or Service Requestor using a telephone number provided by Inspectorama. During this process, Inspectorama and its service provider will receive in real time and store call data, including the date and time of the call or text (SMS) message, the parties’ phone numbers, and the content of the text (SMS) messages. You agree to the masking process described above and to Inspectorama’s use and disclosure of this call data for its legitimate business purposes.

The information described in this section may be transferred to, or processed and stored in, the United States and other countries, which may employ greater or less restrictive data protection laws. In all cases, we will take appropriate measures to protect your personal information in accordance with the policies described herein.

Data Retention

We delete the back-ups of the databases containing your Personal Information after 13 months.
howWeUseTheInfoWeCollect.title: II. HOW WE USE THE PERSONAL INFORMATION WE COLLECT

informationWeCollect.info3rdPartiesProvideAboutYou:
e) Information Third Parties Provide About You

Conversion Tracking: We may supplement the information we collect about you through the Inspectorama Platform with records received from third parties in order to enhance our ability to serve you, to tailor our content to you, and to offer you information that we believe may be of interest to you. For example, websites on which we have placed advertisements, such as Google, may tell us which ads about Inspectorama you clicked. This is often called 'conversion tracking.'

Background Checks: In addition, when third parties such as Hirease, Onfido or Checkr.com conduct background checks on service professionals, those third parties share the results of the background check with Inspectorama.

Recording Phone Calls: Selected third-parties, including those who may assist in providing customer service support, may monitor and/or record the contents of phone calls made through or in relation to the Inspectorama Platform, after notice to you and with your consent.

Social Networking Sites: If you login to the Inspectorama Platform through a social networking site, such as Facebook, we may collect your Facebook authentication token and account identification number and use that information to provide you with access to your account on the Inspectorama Platform.

Ratings and Reviews: If you are using the Inspectorama Platform as a service professional, we may receive information about you in the form of ratings and reviews from requesters who engaged your professional services through the Inspectorama Platform.

Photographs of Completed Services: If you are using the Inspectorama Platform to request services, service professionals booked through the Inspectorama Platform may take photographs of completed services and provide them to Inspectorama.

Message Interception: If you call or text (SMS) message a service professional or service requester using the telephone number provided by Inspectorama, Inspectorama uses Twilio to mask your telephone number. During this process, Inspectorama and Twilio receive in real time and store call data, including the date and time of the call or text (SMS) message, the parties’ phone numbers, and the content of the text (SMS) messages.

If you send a message to a service professional or service requester in the App, Inspectorama uses Sendbird to process the communications. During this process, Inspectorama and Sendbird receive in real time and store message data, including the date, time, and content of the messages.

If you are using the Inspectorama Platform as a service professional, we may receive information about you in the form of ratings and reviews from Requesters who engaged your professional services through the Inspectorama Platform.

We will apply this Privacy Policy to any Personal Information received from third parties, unless we have disclosed otherwise.
informationWeCollect.infoYouProvideToA3rdParty:
f) Information You Provide to a Third Party

The Inspectorama Platform includes links from the Inspectorama Platform to sites or applications operated by third parties ('Third-Party Sites') and plug-ins (such as Twitter buttons) from Third-Party Sites.

For example, service professionals may be directed to a Third Party Site, such as Checkr.com, Onfido.com, SterlingTalentSolutions.com, or Hirease.com, so that the Third Party Site can conduct a background check. The Third Party Site may ask the service professional for identifying information to conduct the background check.

Some Third-Party Sites link to Inspectorama and share information with Inspectorama. For example, in some cases, you can book services through the Inspectorama Platform with one of our booking partners (“Booking Partner”), such as Amazon, Facebook, Walmart and Wayfair. In that case, you might provide the booking information, such as your name, telephone number, email address, and booking address, to the Booking Partner. The Booking Partner might then share the necessary booking information with us.

Inspectorama does not control any Third-Party Sites, and is not responsible for any information they may collect. The information collection practices of a Third-Party Site are governed by that site's privacy policy.

We recommend that you read the Third-Party Site's privacy policy if you choose to enter any Third-Party Site or click on a plug-in.
informationWeCollect.informationCollectedByMobileApp:
c) Information Collected by Mobile Applications

When you use the App, the App may automatically collect and store some or all of the following information from your mobile device ('Mobile Device Information'), including, but not limited to:

  • The type of Internet browsers you use with the App.
  • Your preferred country site.
  • Your mobile operating system.
  • Your phone number or other identifiers assigned to your mobile device, including: The IP address of your mobile device, The manufacturer and model of your mobile device

We may also collect information about how you use the App, such as the amount of time you spend using the App, how many times you use a specific feature of the App over a given time period, how often you use the App, and actions you take in the App. In addition, we may gather information about the website from which you downloaded the App to help us determine what App download site is most effective (collectively 'App Usage Information').

We may link your Mobile Device Information and App Usage Information to Personal Information you have provided us, in which case we will treat the combined information as Personal Information.

Location Tracking

If you are a service professional using Inspectorama’s mobile application for service professionals (the 'Pro Portal'), we may collect your geographic location by using Global Positioning System (GPS) information sent to us from the Pro Portal. For more information on when this information is collected, how we use it, and with whom it is shared, services professionals should refer to the Service Professional Agreement available on the service professional portal.

We only collect location information about service professionals who have been accepted to participate on the Inspectorama Platform and not about service requesters or about service professionals applying to participate in the Inspectorama Platform.
informationWeCollect.informationWeCollectThruTech:
b) Information We Collect Through Technology

We collect information through technology to enhance our ability to serve you. When you access and use the Inspectorama Platform, or contact Inspectorama or its third-party service providers, Inspectorama and, in some cases, our third-party service providers collect information about you or how you interact with the Inspectorama Platform. We describe below a few of the methods we use to collect information through technology.

When you visit the Inspectorama Platform, we collect your Internet Protocol (IP) address. An IP address is often associated with the portal you used to enter the Internet, like your Internet service provider (ISP), company, association, or university. While an IP address may reveal your ISP or geographic area, we cannot determine your identity solely based upon your IP address. However, we may link the last IP address you used to access the Inspectorama Platform to Personal Information you provide us. Where, according to local law, IP addresses and the like are considered Personal Information, we treat them as such.

We may also collect a unique identifier for your computer, mobile device, or other device used to access the Inspectorama Platform 'Device Identifier'). A Device Identifier is a number that is automatically assigned to the device you used to access the Inspectorama Platform. We may link the Device Identifier to other information about your visit, such as what pages you viewed, and to Personal Information you provide us, such as your name.

Do We Use Cookies?

Yes. For more information about cookies, please visit our Cookies Policy.

Web Beacons

We may include small graphic images or other web programming code, called web beacons (also known as 'pixel tags', 'web bugs' or 'clear GIFs'), in our web and mobile pages and messages. The web beacons are minute graphics with a unique identifier. They are used to track the online movements of Web users. In contrast to cookies, which are stored in a user's computer hard drive, web beacons are embedded invisibly on Web pages and are about the size of the period at the end of this sentence. Web beacons help us better manage content on the Inspectorama Platform by informing us what content is effective, monitoring how users navigate the Inspectorama Platform, counting users of the Inspectorama Platform, and counting how many e-mails sent by us were actually opened.

Your 'Do Not Track' Browser Setting

We do not support the Do Not Track (DNT) browser setting. DNT is a preference you can set in your browser's settings to let the websites you visit know that you do not want the websites collecting your Personal Information.

We do track your online activities over time and across third-party websites or online services. For example, we use web beacons to help us determine what links or advertisers brought you to our Site. We also use third-party service providers to display advertisements to you on other websites based on your activities while on the Inspectorama Platform.
informationWeCollect.informationYouProvideAbout3rdParty:
d) Information You Provide About A Third Party

If you choose to use our referral service to tell a friend about the Inspectorama Platform, we may collect your friend's name and email address. We will automatically send your friend a one-time email inviting him or her to visit the Inspectorama Platform. We store this information only to send this one-time email and to track the success of our referral program. We do not use this information for any other marketing purpose unless we obtain consent from that person or we explicitly say otherwise. Please be aware that when you refer a friend, your e-mail address may be included in the message sent to your friend.

If you are using the Inspectorama Platform to request professional services, you may provide us ratings and reviews of the service professionals you engage through the Inspectorama Platform.
informationWeCollect.personalInformationYouGiveUS:
a) Personal Information You Give Us

We collect information that you voluntarily share with us through the Inspectorama Platform.

If you are using the Inspectorama Platform to request professional services, or contact Inspectorama or its third-party service providers, you may give us:

  • Contact information, such as your name, physical address, telephone number, and email address
  • Information about your inspected item, such as home, vehicle, zip code or postal code where the item is located and your instructions for carrying the inspection service
  • Billing information, such as credit or debit card number, expiration date & security code and/or information regarding your PayPal, Google Wallet or other digital payment accounts and the Inspectorama Platform itself
  • Ratings and reviews of the service professionals you engage through the Inspectorama Platform

If you participate on the Inspectorama Platform as a service professional, or contact Inspectorama or its third-party service providers, you may give us:

  • Contact information, such as your name, email address, mailing address, and phone number
  • Log-in information, including your Inspectorama Platform username and password
  • Application information, if requesting consideration to participate as a service professional through the Inspectorama Platform, such as your experience, skills, eligibility to work, and availability
  • Photographs of yourself
  • Social Security number, if you are selected for a background check

If you apply on the Inspectorama Platform for employment with Inspectorama, you may give us:

  • Contact information, including your name, email address, telephone number, and mailing address
  • Resume and LinkedIn profile

More about payment card information:

Although users can submit credit card or other payment card information to pay for a service through the Inspectorama Platform, Inspectorama does not receive this information itself. Payment card information is transmitted directly to a third-party payment card processor, Stripe, through an Internet connection secured by industry-standard Transport Layer Security (TLS) encryption technology. Stripe then communicates to Inspectorama whether your payment has cleared, but does not provide payment card information to Inspectorama.

Surveys

You may, at your choice, complete surveys on the Inspectorama Platform or distributed by Inspectorama about, for example, your level of satisfaction with the Inspectorama Platform, your engagement with the Inspectorama Platform, and your awareness of Inspectorama Platform features. In some cases, we may link the information you provide in the survey with Personal Information in your Inspectorama account, such as your name or email address. When linked to Personal Information, your survey information becomes Personal Information too.
informationWeCollect.title: I. INFORMATION WE COLLECT

privacyPolicy.intro:
Effective Date:October 1st, 2019


Zigma Inspection Services AS, and its affiliates, parents, and subsidiaries ('Inspectorama' or 'we', 'us', or the 'Company') take your privacy seriously. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, share, and protect your Personal Information. If you do not want us to handle your Personal Information in this manner, please do not use the Inspectorama Platform. Personal Information is information that relates to you as an individually identifiable person, such as your name, e-mail address, and mobile number.

This Privacy Policy explains:

  • What information we collect
  • How we use that information
  • How we may share that information
  • How we protect your information
  • Our Privacy Shield Privacy Policy and information specific to non-US users
  • How to contact us with questions about this Privacy Policy

This Privacy Policy applies only to (a) information that we collect on the websites Inspectorama.com, (b) through the Inspectorama mobile applications, including the mobile application for service requesters and the mobile application for service professionals.

ourShieldPrivacyPolicy.accessAndCorrection:
g) Access And Correction: How You Can Exercise Your Rights

Inspectorama acknowledges EEA Individuals’ right to access and correct their Personal Information. Upon reasonable request, Inspectorama will grant EEA Individuals reasonable access to their Personal Information and will permit them to correct, amend or delete Personal Information that is inaccurate or incomplete. EEA Individuals wishing to exercise these rights may do so by contacting privacy@inspectorama.com Employees should contact their local manager to exercise these rights.
ourShieldPrivacyPolicy.crossBorderDataTransfers:
d) Cross-Border Data Transfers:

The Personal Information collected through the Site will be transferred to the United States. The recipients of Personal Information collected through the Site (listed in Section III above) are located in the United States and the Philippines or in the country where the data was collected and the data that is transferred will be subject to Privacy Shield.
ourShieldPrivacyPolicy.disclosureOfPersonalInfo:
c) Notice Inspectorama's Use And Disclosure Of Personal Information

Before processing the Personal Information of any EEA Individual, Inspectorama, or its local affiliate, provides the EEA Individual with a notice concerning the processing of his or her Personal Information. The notice, including this Privacy Policy, are available for review on the Inspectorama Platform and/or provided directly to the EEA Individual.

Inspectorama receives the Personal Information of Inspectorama Platform users and processes it for the purposes described in this Privacy Policy. Inspectorama may disclose this Personal Information to third parties as described in the Privacy Policy.

Inspectorama receives the Personal Information of applicants for employee positions located in the Member States and Switzerland ('Applicants') to administer the recruitment process and, of employees, to administer the employment relationship. Examples of the purposes for which Inspectorama collects and uses employee and Applicant Personal Information include, without limitation, recruitment; workforce management; to administer compensation, payroll, and benefits; to address various legal obligations related to the employment relationship, including discovery obligations in civil litigation; to administer training; to administer Inspectorama’s compliance process; and for emergency contact purposes.

The employee and Applicant Personal Information that Inspectorama US receives from the EEA and Switzerland consists largely of information provided by Applicants, such as resumes and completed job applications and information created by Inspectorama or its affiliates to administer the employment relationship, such as business contact information, and compensation and benefits information.

Inspectorama may disclose employee and Applicant Personal Information, subject to written agreement, to authorized service providers who provide services related to the administration of the recruitment process and/or the employment relationship. Inspectorama also may disclose employee and Applicant Personal.

Information to corporate affiliates in connection with the recruitment process and for internal employment administration purposes, such as to administer access to physical facilities and information systems and for succession planning.

Inspectorama may be required to disclose, and may disclose, EEA and Swiss Personal Information in response to lawful requests by public authorities, including for the purpose of meeting national security or law enforcement requirements.
ourShieldPrivacyPolicy.enforcement:
h) Enforcement: What To Do If You Have a Complaint

In compliance with the Privacy Shield Principles, Inspectorama commits to resolve complaints about your privacy and our collection or use of your personal information transferred to the United States pursuant to Privacy Shield. European Union and Swiss individuals with Privacy Shield inquiries or complaints should first contact Inspectorama at privacy@inspectorama.com.

Inspectorama has further committed to refer unresolved privacy complaints under the Privacy Shield Principles to an independent dispute resolution mechanism, the BBB EU PRIVACY SHIELD, operated by the Council of Better Business Bureaus. If you do not receive timely acknowledgment of your complaint, or if your complaint is not satisfactorily addressed, please visit www.bbb.org/EU-privacy-shield/for-eu-consumers for more information and to file a complaint. This service is provided free of charge to you.

Inspectorama commits to cooperate with the panel established by the EU data protection authorities (DPAs) and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner and comply with the advice given by the EU DPA’s and Swiss FDPIC with regard to human resources data transferred from the EU and Switzerland in the context of the employment relationship.

If your Privacy Shield complaint cannot be resolved through the above channels, under certain conditions, you may invoke binding arbitration for some residual claims not resolved by other redress mechanisms. See Privacy Shield Annex 1 at https://www.privacyshield.gov/article?id=ANNEX-I-introduction

Contact details for the EU data protection authorities can be found at http://ec.europa.eu/justice/data-protection/bodies/authorities/index_en.htm. Contact details for the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner can be found at https://www.edoeb.admin.ch/edoeb/en/home/the-fdpic/links/data-protection---switzerland.html

In compliance with the Privacy Shield Principles, Inspectorama commits to resolve complaints about our collection or use of employees’ Personal Information.  Current or former employees with inquiries regarding the Privacy Shield or who wish to submit a complaint concerning the handling of their Personal Information should first contact Inspectorama at: privacy@inspectorama.com. Current or former employees who are not satisfied with the internal resolution of a complaint may seek redress from the panel established by the EU data protection authorities (DPAs) and/or the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (the “Commissioner”), as applicable. Inspectorama will cooperate in investigations by, and comply with the advice of, the panel and/or Commissioner with regard to an employee’s Personal Information transferred from the EU and/or Switzerland in the context of the employment relationship.
ourShieldPrivacyPolicy.howToOptOut:
f) Choice: How To Opt Out Of Collection Of Your Personal Information By Inspectorama And Transfer To Third Parties

Inspectorama may disclose EEA Individuals’ Personal Information transferred to the United States pursuant to the Privacy Shield to non-agent third parties as described in Section III above. In some cases, as described in Section III of this Privacy Policy, our third-party service providers may in turn share the Personal Information of Inspectorama Platform users with other third parties. You may opt out of such disclosures and onward transfers by writing to privacy@inspectorama.com

Inspectorama will offer EEA Individuals whose Personal Information has been transferred to the United States pursuant to the Privacy Shield the opportunity to opt out from: (a) the disclosure of their Personal Information to any non-agent third parties not already listed in Section III above and (b) the use of their Personal Information for purpose(s) that are not compatible with the purpose(s) for which the Personal Information was originally collected or subsequently authorized by the Individual. Inspectorama will provide EEA Individuals with clear, conspicuous, and readily available mechanisms to exercise choice. should such circumstances arise. Any withdrawal will apply only prospectively, and Inspectorama will continue to retain the Personal Information that EEA Individuals provided before they withdrew their consent for as long as allowed or required by applicable law.
ourShieldPrivacyPolicy.individualsInTheEU:
b) For Individuals in the EU, EEA and/or Switzerland

To provide an adequate level of protection for Personal Information received from the Member States of the European Economic Area ('EEA') and from Switzerland, Zigma Inspection Services AS, ('Inspectorama') complies with the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield Framework and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield Frameworks as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce (“Privacy Shield Principles”) when processing the Personal Information of natural persons located in the EEA and Switzerland (collectively, 'EEA Individuals') whose data is transferred into the US pursuant to the Privacy Shield. EEA Individuals include users of the Inspectorama Platform, such as service requesters and service professionals. EEA Individuals also include employees of Inspectorama US’ affiliated companies located in the Member States. Please note that service professionals who provide services through the Inspectorama Platform are independent contractors and are not employees of Inspectorama or employees of any of Inspectorama’s affiliated companies, including those located in the Member States.

Inspectorama has certified that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles with respect to such data. If there is any conflict between the policies in this privacy policy and data subject rights under the Privacy Shield Principles, the Privacy Shield Principles shall govern. To learn more about the Privacy Shield program, and to view our certification page, please visit https://www.privacyshield.gov/
ourShieldPrivacyPolicy.legalBasesForProcessing:
e) Legal Bases For Processing:

Consent and as Required by Law: Inspectorama processes your Personal Information with your consent and as required by law.

Contract: Users can enter into two different types of contracts through the Inspectorama Platform: (1) a contract between service requesters and service professionals regarding professional services, and (2) a contract between the user and Inspectorama whereby Inspectorama facilitates the arrangement of the professional services contract in exchange for a share of the fee for the contracted professional services. To take steps necessary to respond to users’ requests to enter into both types of contracts, Inspectorama processes Personal Information from service requesters, including contact information, services requested, and worksite location information, and from service professionals, including contact information, skills and experience, background check information, preferred times, and preferred locations. To facilitate the performance of the service professional agreement and to perform the contract with users, Inspectorama must process Personal Information, including the service requester’s billing information, the service professional’s receivables information and geographic location information, and both parties’ text messages and phone calls through the Inspectorama Platform.

Inspectorama cannot facilitate service professional contracts through the Inspectorama Platform or enter into contracts with users unless users provide this Personal Information.

Legitimate Interests: Inspectorama also processes Personal Information as necessary for its legitimate interests as follows:

  • Marketing and advertising: Unless you opt out as described below, we use your Personal Information as necessary to provide you information about the services that we think might interest you, in accordance with applicable law.
  • Network and information security, fraud prevention, and reporting suspected criminal acts: In the event of fraud, a security incident, or a suspected criminal act, we would examine Personal Information that appeared to be linked to the incident as necessary to determine what happened, remediate, report to the authorities, and prevent a recurrence.

Right to Object to Processing for Direct Marketing or Legitimate Interests:

EEA Individuals have the right to object to the processing of their Personal Information for purposes of Inspectorama’s direct marketing or legitimate interests by contacting Inspectorama at privacy@inspectorama.com

Automated decision-making:

Inspectorama sometimes uses EEA Individuals’ Personal Information submitted through the Site for automated decision-making. For example, Inspectorama may display advertisements and send emails to you containing content automatically chosen based on the services you have ordered through the Inspectorama Platform in the past. However, Inspectorama will not use EEA Individuals’ Personal Information submitted through the Site for automated decision-making, including profiling, which produces legal effects or similarly significantly affects the EEA Individual.

Individual Rights:

EEA Individuals have the right to access their Personal Information collected by the Site and to request that Inspectorama update, correct, or delete their Personal Information as provided by applicable law. EEA Individuals also have the right to object to, or restrict, Inspectorama’s processing of their Personal Information.

In addition, EEA Individuals have the right to data portability concerning their Personal Information. Subject to certain limitations, the right to data portability allows EEA Individuals to obtain from Inspectorama, or to ask Inspectorama to send to a third party, a digital copy of the Personal Information that they provided to the Site. EEA Individuals’ right to access their Personal Information includes their right to receive a copy of all, or a portion, of their Personal Information in Inspectorama’s possession as long as Inspectorama’s providing the Personal Information would not adversely affect the rights and freedoms of others.

body.term1:
1.The Inspectorama Platform is Solely a Venue for Communications; Background Checks.

a.The Inspectorama Platform is Solely a Venue for Communications. The Inspectorama Platform is a communications platform for enabling the connection between individuals seeking to obtain services ('Requesters') and/or individuals and entities seeking to provide services ('Professionals'). Requesters and Professionals together are referred to as'Users'. Those certain services requested by the Requesters, which are to be completed by the Professionals, are hereinafter referred to as'Professional Services'. The Professional Services include the inspection of the item of the Requester booked through the Inspectorama Platform. The provision of all Professional Services is up to the Professionals, which may be scheduled through use of the Inspectorama Platform. INSPECTORAMA, THROUGH THE INSPECTORAMA PLATFORM, OFFERS INFORMATION AND A METHOD TO OBTAIN SUCH PROFESSIONAL SERVICES, BUT DOES NOT AND DOES NOT INTEND TO PROVIDE SUCH PROFESSIONAL SERVICES ITSELF OR ACT IN ANY WAY AS A RETAILER, MANUFACTURER,   OR EMPLOYER, AND EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ANY RESPONSIBILITY OR LIABILITY FOR ANY PROFESSIONAL SERVICES AND PROVIDED TO THE REQUESTER, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, A WARRANTY OR CONDITION OF GOOD AND WORKMANLIKE SERVICES, WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR COMPLIANCE WITH ANY LAW, REGULATION, OR CODE.

b.Background Checks and Licensing. INSPECTORAMA CHECKS THE BACKGROUNDS OF PROFESSIONALS VIA THIRD PARTY BACKGROUND CHECK SERVICES. However, each Requester should exercise caution and common sense to protect its personal safety and property, just as you would when interacting with any person whom you do not know. In some states, licensing may be required by the county or local authority in which the work is being performed. We recommend you confirm these licensing requirements before proceeding with your project. We always recommend that you ask the Professional to provide you with a copy of their license. INSPECTORAMA PERFORMS SCREENING SOLELY AT THE TIME THE PROFESSIONAL APPLIES TO REGISTER ON THE INSPECTORAMA PLATFORM. INSPECTORAMA CANNOT AND DOES NOT WARRANT OR REPRESENT THAT A PROFESSIONALS' PROFILE AND BACKGROUND CHECK SCREENING INFORMATION IS UP TO DATE. INSPECTORAMA IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO UPDATE A PROFESSIONAL'S BACKGROUND CHECK OR PROFILE. BY USING THE INSPECTORAMA PLATFORM, THE REQUESTER AGREES TO HOLD INSPECTORAMA FREE FROM THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR ANY LIABILITY OR DAMAGE THAT MIGHT ARISE OUT OF THE PROFESSIONAL SERVICES. INSPECTORAMA IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR THE CONDUCT, WHETHER ONLINE OR OFFLINE, OF ANY USER INCLUDING PROFESSIONALS, AND WILL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, INJURY OR DAMAGE ARISING IN CONNECTION WITH ANY PROFESSIONAL SERVICES.
